Fish and Chips

Green Chillis 3 Numbers 
Cucumber 1 Tablespoons 
Onions 1 Numbers 
Beer as needed 
Cornflour 1/2 Teaspoons 
Maida 1 Tablespoons 
Lemon Juice 1 Numbers 
Red Chilli Powder as needed 
Salt as needed 
Fish 1 Numbers 
Vinegar 1 Tablespoons

1.Take a plate add lemon juice, salt,red chilli powder mix well then dip the fish fille both the side.\n2.Take a bowl add All purpose Flour ie maida, salt, baking powder, beer mix this well, keep it in a fridge for 15min. andd yellow food color In another plate add cornflour and maida dip the marinated fish both the side.\n3.To make a mock sauce add vinegar,onion,cucumber, green chillis chopped microwave for 1min cool it down and add it to mayonees mix well. dip fish in batter and deep fry
Russian salad

Peas 1 Tablespoons 
Spring Onions 1 Numbers 
Onion Chopped 1 Numbers 
Beans 6 Numbers 
Carrot 1 Numbers 
Potato 1 Numbers 
Mayonnaise 1 Tablespoons 
Cream 1 Tablespoons
Take a bowl add cream and mayonnaise mix well keep it a sideIn a bowl add potato cut into cubes boiled,carrot,beans,onions,spring onions, peas, and cream mixture mix well.
Baby Corn Cigars

Oil for deep fry
Garam Masala 1 Teaspoons
Chopped Coriander 1 Bunch
Chat Masala 1 Teaspoons
Chilly Flakes 10 Grams
Baby Corn 10 Numbers
Mozzarella Cheese 50 Grams
Egg 1 Numbers
Corn Flour 60 Grams
Refined Flour 100 Grams
Salt To Taste
Jeera Powder 1 Teaspoons

Make a thin wrappers in non stick pan with corn flour, refined flour, egg, water make. Blanch a baby corn and slit them Make a stuffing with cheese, chat masala, chopped coriander, garam masala, jeera powder, Stuff these mixtures in to the baby corn, Place the stuffed baby corn in the sheet and roll it into the Cigar shape. Deep fry them till golden brown colour. Serve it with chilly garlic sauce.
Veggie Momos Perogies

Cabbage 100 Grams 
Parsley Chopped 1 Tablespoons 
Pepper 1 Teaspoons 
Butter 1 Teaspoons 
Cheese 1 Tablespoons 
Potatoes 200 Grams 
Sour Cream 1 Tablespoons 
Salt To Taste 
All Purpose Flour 150 Grams 
Olive Oil 1 Tablespoons 
Onion ( Slices) 1 Numbers

1.Take a bowl adds all-purpose flour, salt, sour cream, sprinkle water; make this into soft dough, knead the dough for 5 minutes, cover it and rest it for 20 minutes.
2. Take another bowl add boiled and grated potato, salt, grated cheese, butter, pepper, chopped parsley mix it well. 
3.Take the dough and using rolling pin roll a big thin sheet 
4.and take a cutter and cut them into small disc and stuff with the potato mixture and grated cabbage, using water and fold over, pinching edges together to seal, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil, drop perogies in boiling water and cook for 7 to 8 minutes until they float.
5. Take a pan add olive oil heat it and add slice of onions, salt, pepper, mix herbs mix it well and add boiled perogies, toss them. Serve this hot.
Pot Chicken Rice Oriental Biryani

Onion (medium) 1 Numbers 
Carrot 2 Numbers 
Mushrooms 150 Grams 
Oyster Sauce 1 Tablespoons 
Soya Sauce (dark) 1 Tablespoons 
Soya Sauce (light) 1 Tablespoons 
Chicken Pieces 200 Grams 
Green Chilly 3 Numbers 
Ginger Slices 1 inch Piece 
Garlic Slices 3 Clove 
Oil 1 Tablespoons 
Salt To Taste 
Chicken Stock 2 Cup 
Rice 1 Cup

1.Heat oil in a clay pot add slice of garlic, ginger, add green chilly, chicken pieces, light Soya sauce, dark Soya sauce, oyster sauce, cook this few minutes and add mushrooms, carrot, onion dices,\n2. add salt, chicken stock, once come to boil add rice (soak the rice for 30 minutes) mix it well, put the lid on let it cook for 10 minutes, (you can cook this in the oven at 200 c for 20 to 30 minutes) once mix the rice then cook this in a slow flame for 1 more minute, switch off the flame and rest it for 10 minutes and then serve it.
Garlic Toast

Bread Slices 
Cheese as need 
Garlic 5 Numbers 
Butter as needed
In ding chick add garlic make a paste then add butter, cheese make afine paste.Take bread slices apply this mixture on top and gril it for 5min or till golden brown colour.
Banana Bread

WHITE SUGAR 1 1/4 Cup 
SOFTENED BUTTER 1 1/2 Cup 
EGGES 2 Large 
MASHED RIPE BANANAS 3-4 Numbers 
BUTTER MILK 1 Cup 
VANILLA 1 Teaspoons 
ALL PURPOSE FLOUR 2 1/2 Cup 
BAKING SODA 1 Teaspoons

Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
Grease bottoms only of 2 loaf pans with shortening.
Mix sugar and butter in large bowl.
Stir in eggs until blended.
Add bananas,buttermilk,and vanilla.
Stir in flour,baking soda.
Mix well.Fill each pan halfway.
Bake about 1 hour to 1 1/4 hours or until toothpick when i nserted in centre comes out clean.
Cool 5 min.
Loosen sides from pan then remove.
Store at room temparature upto 10 days.
Popcorn Paneer With Homemade Cheese

Chaat Masala 1 Tablespoons 
Parmesan Cheese (optional) 1/2 Teaspoons 
Oil For Deep Frying 
Water As Needed 
Corn Flour 1 Cup 
Maida (all-purpose Flour) 1 Cup 
Bread Crumbs 1 Tablespoons 
Maida (all-purpose Flour) 1 Tablespoons 
Grated Paneer (Indian Cottage Cheese) 1 Cup 
Red Chilli Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Salt To Taste 
Cumin Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Tomato Ketchup 1 Tablespoons 
Grated Cheese (any Processed Cheese0 1/2 Cup 
Marjoram Spice 1/2 Teaspoons 
Oregano 1/2 Teaspoons

1. In a bowl, combine any processed grated cheese, tomato ketchup, cumin powder, red chilli powder, pinch of salt, grated paneer, all-purpose flour, and bread crumbs. Mix all these ingredients together and knead to form dough. Gently squeeze out small popcorn size dumplings and keep aside or else roll the dough into thin cylindrical shape and cut into small piece (as shown in video). In a plate, mix equal quantities of corn flour, all-purpose flour and salt and mix well. Remove half the quantity of the flours in another plate.
2. Add little water in one portion of the flour quantity and make a smooth paste free of lumps. Drop the small dumpling into the flour batter and coat them well. Remove and drop into the other portion of the dry flour and keep aside. Coat the entire dumplings in the same process.
3. Heat oil in and pan and when the oil is hot, fry the coated dumplings on medium hot oil until they turn slight golden in colour and crisp. For the popcorn masala, in a bowl, 
4. add chaat masala, parmesan cheese (optional), marjoram and oregano, mix the spices together and sprinkle over the fried popcorn paneer.
Onion rings

Water as needed 
Oil To Fry 1 To Fry 
Chilli Powder as per taste To Taste 
Salt as per taste To Taste 
Soda pinch Pinch 
Conflour 3 Tablespoons 
Large Onion 1 Numbers 
Maida ( All Purposeflour) 1 Cup 
Bread Crumbs 1 Cup

1.Cut onions into rings and keep a side In a bowl add all purposeflour, cornflour, soda,salt, chilli powder, bread crumbs and mix with water a thick batter. \n2.Now take onion rings coat with the dry flour and dip in the flour mixture andcoat with bread crumbs fry till golden brown colour.
Puff Pastry

Water 110 ml 
Vinegar 4 Drops 
Salt 1 Pinch 
Butter 220 Grams 
Maida/allpurpose Flour 220 Grams

In a bowl melt 4grms of butter.In another bowl add flour, salt, lime juice or vinegar, melted butter, water and kneed the dough.roll the dough in square shape and add the rest of the butter and seal it spread the dough and sprinkle flour and fould 3 times and keep in the fridge for 10min repeat the same 6 times and in the finial roll the sheet evenly all the side and cut into square shape. use these sheets for egg puff or veg.
PRAWN PIL PIL

Chopped Parsley 2 Tablespoons 
Chilly Paste 2 Tablespoons 
Salt To Taste 
Chopped Garlic 2 Teaspoons 
Chilly Flakes 1 Tablespoons 
Olive Oil 300 ml 
Prawns 500 Grams

1.Heat olive oil in a pan add prawns, chilly flakes, chopped garlic, salt, chilly paste, cook for some time and switch off the flame and sprinkle parsley.\n2.Serve this hot with bread or as accompaniment to soup.
Buffalo Wings Crazy Sauce

Sugar 1 Pinch 
Parsley Chopped 2 Tablespoons 
Garlic Chopped 1 Teaspoons 
Chilly Paste 2 Teaspoons 
Butter 1 Tablespoons 
All Purpose Flour 1 Cup 
Oil For Deep-fry 3 Cup 
Chilly Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Ginger, Garlic Paste 1 Tablespoons 
Pepper Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Salt To Taste 
Butter Milk 1 Cup 
Chicken Wings 500 Grams 
Vinegar 1/2 Cup 
Tabasco Sauce 1 Teaspoons

1.Take a bowl marinate the chicken wings with butter milk, salt, pepper powder, ginger garlic paste, chilly powder, leave it for 2 hours. And drain the liquid. And coated the chicken wings with all purpose flour, and deep fry until golden brown, take it aside. Take some butter in a pan add chilly paste (soaked in the vinegar), salt, sugar, chilly powder, vinegar, Tabasco sauce, add chopped garlic, chopped parsley let it cook for 2 minutes.\n2. Put chicken wings on top of the sauce and sauté them.
Paneer with Brinjals Rolls

Chat Masala 1 Teaspoons 
Tomatoes 1 Cup 
Chopped Garlic 1 Teaspoons 
Shahi Jeera 1 Teaspoons 
Chopped Onions 1 Cup 
Salt To Taste 
Paneer 1 Cup 
Eggplant 2 big Numbers 
Coriander 1 Bunch 
Chilly Flakes 1 Teaspoons 
Green Chilly 3 Numbers 
Garam Masala 1 Tablespoons

1.Remove the top of eggplant cut them in to length wise, apply some oil, add salt, put it on a grill, cook it for some time. Keep it aside. Take a bowl and grated paneer, chat masala, chopped coriander, chilly flakes, green chilly, and salt, pinch of garam masala, mix it thoroughly. 
2.Heat oil in a pan add shahi jeera, garlic, chopped onions, chilly powder, garam masala powder, add chopped tomatoes cook it for some time. 
3.Take cheese masala make portions and put it on the thinner side of the eggplant and squeeze it make a roundel and put tooth pick in centre, In the tomato gravy add some water, basil, roasted almond powder and add stuffed eggplants, cook for 5 minutes. 
4.When serve this curry remove the tooth picks. 
5.Serve hot with chapathis, rice.
Almond Horseshoe Cookies

All Purpose Flour 1/4 Teaspoons 
Egg (white) 1 Numbers 
Vanilla Essence 1/2 Teaspoons 
Sugar 1/4 Cup 
Almond Powder 1 1/2 Cup 
Almond Flakes 20 Grams
Milk 1/4 Cup

1.Take a bowl add almond powder, sugar, vanilla essence, egg (white) all purpose flour mix it gently like a dough, 
2.divide the dough into equal portions and roll them into pencil shape and cut them into even sizes and beat one egg pour into the top of this
3. and roll them into almond flakes and shape them (C shape) 
4.and put it on the baking tray and bake them at 200 c for 15 minutes, then give them wash with milk and sugar mixture let it cool down then serve it.
King Prawn Korma Curry

Prawns 150 Grams 
Almonds 10 Grams 
Cashew Nuts 20 Grams 
Melon Seeds 20 Grams 
Poppy Seeds 10 Grams 
Oil 2 Tablespoons 
Cumin Seeds 1/4 Teaspoons 
Whole Garam Masala (each) 2 Numbers 
Green Chilly 2 Numbers 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Teaspoons 
Tomato Puree 1/2 Cup 
Cumin Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Coriander Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Turmeric 1 Pinch 
Chilly Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Garam Masala Powde 1/2 Teaspoons 
Crush Pepper 1/2 Teaspoons

Heat water in a pan add Almonds, cashew nuts, melon seeds, Poppy seeds, cook it for 15 minutes then put it in to the blender and make a fine paste along with fried onions, keep it a side, Heat oil in a pan add cumin seeds, whole garam masala, green chilly, ginger garlic paste, sauté it and add tomato puree, cook it for few minutes, then add prepared nuts paste, add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric, chilly powder, mix it well, add curd, cook this for few minutes then add the king prawns and add crush pepper, add lime juice, put the lid on and let it cook for 2 minutes, then add garam masala powder, mix it well and cook for few minutes then switch off the flame.
